lead_paragraph: Investors typically like the programs, but they can do serious damage: LPL Financial’s buying spree increased its debt but mostly benefited only an insider.

headline.main: Stock Buyback Plans, Seen as Shareholder Boon, Can Backfire

snippet: Investors typically like the programs, but they can do serious damage: LPL Financial’s buying spree increased its debt but mostly benefited only an insider.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column highlights potential downside to stock buybacks for shareholders; examines questionable $275 million repurchase program at LPL Financial Holdings, nation’s largest independent brokerage firm.
